page.title: 14WI,Brownies,Guides,Marnhull.
page.content: The WOMEN'S INSTITUTE in Marnhull was begun in 1926.They meet once a month in the Village Hall.At their meetings the 68 members have a business section,speaker and usually drama.They also run a skittles team,play bridge and tennis.They run classes in dress making,art and other vocational activities.Members attend the WI college at Denman where a wide variety of subjects can be studied.Recently Marnhull entertained members from Denmark.They were taken to local places of interest. BROWNIES and GUIDES,uniformed girls' organisations,meet every Monday in St Gregory's School.The younger Brownies sing,work in groups and play games.The Guides are similar with many practical and social activities leading to awards and badges.
